Title: BrightHR Lite Style Guide
User_Story: As a UI designer, I want a consistent style guide so that all interfaces maintain a professional and uniform appearance.
Functional_Requirements: Primary colors: Blue (#3B82F6), Neutral Gray (#6B7280), White (#FFFFFF), Accent Blue (#60A5FA for highlights); Typography: Arial or system sans-serif (font-family: 'Arial', sans-serif; fallback to system-ui); Spacing: Tailwind defaults with custom scale (4px increments); Buttons: bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-600 active:bg-blue-700 text-white rounded-xl shadow-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500/50 transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out; Forms: Input borders border-gray-300 focus:border-blue-500 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500/50 rounded-xl px-3 py-2; Cards: bg-white shadow-2xl rounded-2xl border border-gray-200 p-8; Navigation: Collapsible sidebar bg-gradient-to-b from-gray-50 to-white text-gray-900 shadow-xl transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out (open: w-72, closed: w-16); Highlights: Subtle blue gradients (bg-gradient-to-r from-blue-500/20 to-blue-600/20) on active states and focus; Icons: Inline SVG Heroicons for nav and buttons (e.g., user-icon for profile); Modern enhancements: Deeper shadows (2xl), rounded-2xl corners, subtle animations (hover scales, fade-ins), gradient button backgrounds (bg-gradient-to-r from-blue-500 to-blue-600 hover:from-blue-600 to-blue-700); Enhanced forms: Label above inputs with blue accent on focus.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Responsive design adherence (mobile-first: sm, md, lg, xl breakpoints); Accessibility: WCAG AA+ compliance (contrast ratios >4.5:1, ARIA labels, keyboard nav, screen reader friendly); Performance: Minimal CSS bloat via Tailwind purge, lightweight animations (CSS transitions only, no heavy JS); Cross-browser: Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge on macOS/Windows; Mac-optimized: System font fallbacks for crisp rendering.
Constraints: GDPR-friendly (no tracking colors); Mac-compatible rendering; No external icon CDNs in MVP (inline SVG if needed); Keep file sizes under 10KB per wireframe
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. All wireframes use defined colors, typography, and enhanced shadows/gradients; 2. Button and form styles match with smooth transitions and hovers; 3. Navigation collapsible and responsive with animations; 4. Cards and highlights apply modern rounded-2xl/slick elements with subtle gradients; 5. No deviations in produced UIs; 6. Icons integrated via inline SVG where applicable; 7. Forms have enhanced focus states and labels; 8. Overall slick, modern feel with deeper shadows and animations
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: All MVP elements require consistent UI
Notes: Updated for ultra-modern slick look: Arial/system font, enhanced blues with gradients, deeper shadows (2xl), rounded-2xl, advanced transitions/animations, collapsible nav with wider open state, inline icons, gradient buttons, enhanced forms; Base theme for all WF-xxx; Extendable for dark mode

Title: Employee Directory Search
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to search the employee directory so that I can quickly find employee details.
Functional_Requirements: Search by name or email; Display results in table; Pagination if >10 results
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User logs in; 2. Enters search term; 3. Results display accurately; 4. No results message if empty
Notes: Traces to Vision MVP must-haves

Title: System Performance for Searches
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want the application to respond quickly to user searches so that the user experience remains efficient.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Search queries must return results in under 2 seconds; Support up to 50 concurrent users without degradation
Constraints: Local SQLite database; No external caching in MVP
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Load test with 50 users shows <2s response; 2. Average search time measured in logs <1.5s; 3. No errors during peak simulation
Notes: Ensures scalability for small business use; Integrates with US-999 navigation for search access

Title: Employee Directory Search UI
User_Story: As a user, I want a clean search interface for the employee directory.
Functional_Requirements: Search input field; Table display with Tailwind styling
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders search box and table; 2. Tailwind classes applied following STYLE-001; 3. Mobile responsive
Notes: UI for US-001; Updated with blue theme highlights, Arial font, card shadows, and slick modern look; Accessible via 'Employee Directory' link in US-999 HR sidebar

Title: Add Employee Profile
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to add new employee profiles so that the directory stays up-to-date with current staff.
Functional_Requirements: Form for name, email, role, start date; Validation for required fields; Save to database
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure data entry (input sanitization); Response time <1s on submit
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User fills form with valid data; 2. Profile saves successfully; 3. New profile appears in search results; 4. Error message for invalid inputs
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Employee directory (basic profiles with contact info, searchable and updatable)
Notes: Expands directory functionality for MVP

Title: Add Employee Profile UI
User_Story: As a user, I want an intuitive form to add employee details.
Functional_Requirements: Form inputs for name, email, role, start date; Submit button; Success/error messages
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders form with Tailwind styling per STYLE-001; 2. Fields are labeled and accessible; 3. Responsive on mobile; 4. Submit button styled correctly
Notes: UI for US-002; Updated with blue theme highlights, Arial font, card shadows, and slick modern look; Entry point: 'Add Employee' button/link from US-999 dashboard or US-001 search results, redirecting to /employees/add

Title: Submit Leave Request
User_Story: As an employee, I want to submit a leave request so that I can notify HR of my absence plans.
Functional_Requirements: Form for dates, type (vacation/sick), reason; Submit for approval; Email notification to manager
Integrations: Database for leave records; Email service (local simulation in MVP)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employee selects dates and type; 2. Request submits; 3. Status shows pending; 4. Notification sent (simulated)
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Leave / absence management (request submission, approval workflows)
Notes: Core self-service for employees

Title: Leave Request Submission UI
User_Story: As an employee, I want a simple form to request leave.
Functional_Requirements: Date pickers, dropdown for type, textarea for reason; Submit button
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML form renders with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Date inputs functional (HTML5); 3. Mobile-friendly; 4. Validation placeholders
Notes: UI for US-003; Updated with blue theme highlights, Arial font, card shadows, and slick modern look; Entry point: 'My Leave Requests' link from US-999 employee menu, redirecting to /leaves/request

Title: Secure Data Handling for Leave Requests
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want secure handling of leave request data so that sensitive employee information is protected.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Encryption for stored data; Role-based access (employees see own requests, HR sees all); Audit logs for submissions
Integrations: SQLite with encryption extension if needed
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Requests encrypted in DB; 2. Unauthorized access denied; 3. Logs record submissions; 4. Data export works for user
Notes: Ensures privacy in MVP; Applies to navigation-protected routes in US-999

Title: Update Employee Profile
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to update existing employee profiles so that the directory remains accurate and current.
Functional_Requirements: Edit form pre-populated with current data; Fields for name, email, role, start date; Validation and save to database
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure updates (audit trail); Response time <1s on submit
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User selects profile to edit; 2. Form loads with existing data; 3. Updates save and reflect in search; 4. Error handling for conflicts
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Employee directory (basic profiles with contact info, searchable and updatable)
Notes: Completes updatable aspect of employee directory

Title: Update Employee Profile UI
User_Story: As a user, I want an editable form for updating employee details.
Functional_Requirements: Pre-filled form inputs; Edit and cancel buttons; Confirmation message
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders editable form with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Buttons for save/cancel; 3. Responsive design; 4. ARIA labels for inputs
Notes: UI for US-004; Updated with blue theme highlights, Arial font, card shadows, and slick modern look; Entry point: Edit button from US-001 search results or US-999 dashboard, redirecting to /employees/:id/edit

Title: Approve Leave Request
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to approve or reject leave requests so that I can manage employee absences effectively.
Functional_Requirements: List of pending requests; Approve/reject buttons with optional comments; Update status and notify employee
Integrations: Database for leave records; Email simulation
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HR views pending requests; 2. Approves/rejects with comment; 3. Status updates; 4. Notification sent
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Leave / absence management (request submission, approval workflows)
Notes: Fills gap in approval workflows

Title: Leave Request Approval UI
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want a dashboard to review and act on leave requests.
Functional_Requirements: Table of requests with details; Action buttons for approve/reject; Comment textarea
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML table with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Buttons and textarea rendered; 3. Mobile responsive; 4. ARIA for actions
Notes: UI for US-005; Updated with blue theme highlights, Arial font, card shadows, and slick modern look; Entry point: 'Leave Approvals' link from US-999 HR sidebar, redirecting to /leaves/approvals

Title: View Leave Calendar
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want a calendar view of employee leaves so that I can oversee absences at a glance.
Functional_Requirements: Calendar display showing approved leaves; Filter by employee or type; Monthly/weekly views; Entry point: HR navigation link 'Leave Calendar' from US-999 dashboard; Redirect to /leaves/calendar post-click.
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Calendar loads with leave events; 2. Filters work; 3. Views switch correctly; 4. No unauthorized access; 5. Navigates seamlessly from US-999 sidebar
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Leave / absence management (calendar views for oversight)
Notes: Provides oversight functionality; Updated to integrate with US-999 navigation for sprint delivery

Title: Leave Calendar View UI
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want a visual calendar for leave planning.
Functional_Requirements: Calendar grid; Event markers for leaves; Filter dropdowns
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML calendar with Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Event styling; 3. Responsive; 4. Filters accessible
Notes: UI for US-006; Updated with blue theme highlights, Arial font, card shadows, and slick modern look; Integrates into US-999 sidebar for HR role, with return path to dashboard

Title: Upload Document
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to upload documents for employees so that contracts and policies are stored securely.
Functional_Requirements: File upload form; Associate with employee; Supported formats (PDF, DOC); Store securely
Integrations: Local file system or database blob
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Select and upload file; 2. Associates with profile; 3. Stores without corruption; 4. Access restricted
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Document storage (secure upload and access for contracts, policies, and compliance docs)
Notes: Starts document storage MVP

Title: Document Upload UI
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want a simple interface to upload employee documents.
Functional_Requirements: File input; Employee selector; Upload button
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML file input with Tailwind per STYLE-001 enhanced; 2. Selector dropdown with blue focus; 3. Responsive with drag-drop area; 4. Progress indicator with gradient; 5. Modern card layout with deeper shadows and rounded-2xl; 6. Arial font and subtle animations on hover
Notes: UI for US-007; Updated to ultra-modern slick: gradient accents, enhanced forms, inline icons, deeper shadows, animations; Entry point: 'Upload Documents' link from US-999 HR sidebar or employee profile, redirecting to /documents/upload

Title: Secure Document Storage
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want secure storage and access for uploaded documents to protect sensitive information.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Encryption at rest; Role-based access; Audit logs for uploads/views
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Files encrypted on upload; 2. Access only to authorized users; 3. Logs track actions; 4. Export/delete functional
Notes: Protects document data in MVP; Enforced via US-999 role-based routes

Title: View Employee Documents
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to view and download employee documents so that I can access contracts and policies when needed.
Functional_Requirements: List of documents associated with employee; View/download buttons; Preview for supported formats
Integrations: Local file system or database blob
Constraints: GDPR compliance (access logging, no unauthorized views)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Select employee; 2. List shows documents; 3. Download works without corruption; 4. Unauthorized access blocked
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Document storage (secure upload and access for contracts, policies, and compliance docs)
Notes: Completes access functionality for document storage MVP

Title: View Employee Documents UI
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want an interface to browse and access employee documents.
Functional_Requirements: Employee selector; Document list with preview/download links; Responsive table
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders selector and table with Tailwind per STYLE-001 enhanced; 2. Buttons/links for actions with gradient hovers; 3. Mobile responsive with card-based list; 4. ARIA labels for accessibility; 5. Modern table with deeper shadows and rounded-2xl cells; 6. Arial font and blue highlight on focus
Notes: UI for US-008; Updated to ultra-modern slick: gradient accents, enhanced tables, inline icons for download, deeper shadows, animations; Entry point: 'View Documents' link from US-999 HR sidebar or employee profile in US-001, redirecting to /documents/:employeeId

Title: User Authentication
User_Story: As a user, I want to log in to the system so that I can access my personalized HR features securely.
Functional_Requirements: Login form with email/password; Role-based session (HR/Employee); Logout functionality
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure authentication (hashed passwords); Session timeout after 30min inactivity
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Valid credentials grant access; 2. Invalid login shows error; 3. Role determines visible features; 4. Logout clears session
Vision_Ref: CONSTRAINTS: Secure access implied in all features
Notes: Foundational security for MVP; Enables role-based access | [2025-12-12 17:20] All AC verified in Sprint Review

Title: User Login UI
User_Story: As a user, I want a simple login interface to access the app.
Functional_Requirements: Email and password inputs; Submit button; Error message display
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML form with Tailwind per STYLE-001 enhanced; 2. Inputs labeled and secure (type=password) with blue focus rings; 3. Responsive on all devices; 4. Error states styled with gradient alerts; 5. Modern card layout with deeper shadows and rounded-2xl; 6. Arial font, subtle animations on submit hover, inline lock icon for password
Notes: UI for US-009; Updated to ultra-modern slick: gradient buttons, enhanced forms with icons, deeper shadows, animations, premium feel; Entry point: Initial app load at /login, redirects to US-999 dashboard post-auth

Title: Role-Based Access Control
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want role-based access so that users see only appropriate features and data.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Enforce HR vs Employee permissions; Audit unauthorized attempts; Scalable to future roles
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employees can't access HR views; 2. HR can access all; 3. Permissions checked on each page load; 4. Logs unauthorized access
Notes: Supports secure, differentiated user experiences in MVP | [2025-12-12 17:20] All AC verified in Sprint Review

User_Story: As an employee, I want to view my own leave requests so that I can track their status.

Title: View Own Leave Requests UI

Title: Employee Self-Service Profile Update
User_Story: As an employee, I want to update my own profile details so that I can keep my contact information current without HR intervention.
Functional_Requirements: Edit form pre-populated with current personal data; Editable fields: email, phone, address; Validation and save to database with HR notification
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure updates (audit trail, employee-only access); Response time <1s on submit
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Employee logs in and accesses own profile; 2. Form loads with existing editable data; 3. Updates save and HR is notified; 4. Invalid inputs show errors; 5. Changes reflect in directory search
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Employee directory (basic profiles with contact info, searchable and updatable)
Notes: Fills gap in employee self-service for profile updates, aligning with Vision's updatable profiles

Title: Employee Self-Service Profile Update UI
User_Story: As an employee, I want a user-friendly form to edit my own profile information.
Functional_Requirements: Pre-filled form inputs for editable fields (email, phone, address); Save and cancel buttons; Success message with notification info
Non_Functional_Requirements: Responsive design; Accessibility (labels, ARIA for inputs)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders editable form with Tailwind styling per STYLE-001; 2. Fields labeled and accessible; 3. Responsive on mobile; 4. Save/cancel buttons styled; 5. Success message displays correctly
Notes: UI for US-011, consistent with other profile forms; Entry point: 'Update Profile' link from US-999 employee menu, redirecting to /profile/edit with success redirect back to dashboard

Title: Local Mac Environment Setup
User_Story: As a developer, I want a simple local setup for the Mac so that I can run the app easily without external dependencies.
Functional_Requirements: Not specified
Non_Functional_Requirements: Platform: Mac local (Ventura+), web-based (localhost access only in MVP); Backend framework and version: Node.js v18+ with Express (handles API endpoints and serves static frontend files); Frontend approach: Plain HTML/CSS/JS served by Express from /public (NO React/Vue for MVP—keeps it lightweight and fast to develop); Database: SQLite via sqlite3 npm package (v5.1+) (file-based DB stored in the project directory, ./data.sqlite for production; :memory: for tests when NODE_ENV=test—no server setup required); Use sqlite3 package (NOT better-sqlite3); Callback-based API: db.run(), db.get(), db.all() with callback functions; Pattern: Wrap all database callbacks in Promises for async/await compatibility, e.g., new Promise((resolve, reject) => { db.run(sql, params, (err) => { if (err) reject(err); else resolve(); }); }); Server Port: Single port 3000 (backend and static frontend both served from http://localhost:3000 for simplicity); Test framework: Node.js native test runner (node --test) (NO Jest, Mocha, or other frameworks); Development: npm scripts in package.json: 'start': starts the Express server (backend + static files) on port 3000; 'test': NODE_ENV=test node --test (runs Node.js native tests with in-memory database); Full setup: `npm install` for dependencies (Node.js via Homebrew or nvm); use .env for config (e.g., PORT=3000, DB_PATH=./data.sqlite); Seeding: On first run, seed test data via backend script: 1 admin user (admin@test.com / Password123! hashed with bcrypt), 5 sample employee records; Code patterns: Use async/await for all async operations; try/catch for error handling in all endpoints; Cross-platform portability: relative paths only; minimal native modules; Mac-Specific Notes: Install Node.js (v18+) via Homebrew (`brew install node`); Ensure DB file writable; test on M1/M2 (arm64 compatible); Allow localhost:3000 in firewall if prompted; README.md with steps: '1. Install Node. 2. Clone repo. 3. npm install. 4. npm start. Access: http://localhost:3000.'; Testing: Smoke tests via Node.js native test runner (npm test executes `node --test`—no external frameworks like Jest for MVP); Portability & Gotchas: Relative paths only; minimal native modules for cross-platform ease; Gitignore .env and DB file for security; Budget constraints: Total pilot budget under $5K, focusing on local development to avoid hosting fees initially.
Integrations: Local SQLite DB; npm for dependencies
Constraints: Mac-compatible setup; Cross-platform portability; Budget under $5K; No external frameworks like Jest for MVP
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. npm install completes with dependencies; 2. npm start launches Express server on port 3000 with static files served; 3. Access http://localhost:3000 loads the app; 4. Database file ./data.sqlite is created and seeded with admin user and sample employees; 5. npm test runs Node.js native tests successfully with in-memory DB; 6. All async operations use async/await and try/catch; 7. Setup works on macOS Ventura+ without external services.
Vision_Ref: CONSTRAINTS: Local run on Mac, SQLite; TECHNICAL STACK
Notes: Enforces lightweight MVP; Aligns exactly with Vision technical stack; Foundational for all stories. | [2025-12-12 17:20] All AC verified in Sprint Review

Title: Role-Based Dashboard and Navigation
User_Story: As a user, I want a role-specific dashboard after login so that I can easily access relevant HR features without manual navigation.
Functional_Requirements: BACKEND: GET /api/user/role endpoint to fetch user role from session; Middleware to check role and redirect post-login to /dashboard; API for dynamic menu items based on role (e.g., HR: directory, approvals; Employee: own leaves, profile). FRONTEND: Post-login redirect to /dashboard; Sidebar or top navigation with role-based links (e.g., HR: 'Employee Directory', 'Leave Approvals', 'Documents'; Employee: 'My Leave Requests', 'Update Profile'); Welcome message with user name; Logout button. TEST DATA: Use seeded admin user for HR role testing.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure role enforcement (session-based); Responsive navigation (mobile-friendly sidebar); Load time <1s; Accessibility (ARIA for nav links)
Integrations: Session management from US-009; Database for user roles
Constraints: GDPR compliance (no exposure of unauthorized links); Lightweight (no heavy JS frameworks)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User logs in and is redirected to /dashboard; 2. Dashboard shows role-specific welcome and navigation menu; 3. HR sees links to directory, approvals, etc.; 4. Employee sees links to personal features only; 5. Clicking nav links loads correct pages; 6. Logout from dashboard clears session; 7. Unauthorized access attempts redirect or deny; 8. Navigation responsive on mobile
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: Centralized platform with role-based access
Notes: Foundational navigation hub; Integrates existing features without per-feature stories; Improves UX flow post-login | [2025-12-12 17:20] All AC verified in Sprint Review

Title: Role-Based Dashboard and Navigation UI
User_Story: As a user, I want an intuitive dashboard with navigation tailored to my role.
Functional_Requirements: HTML structure for dashboard: Header with welcome/user name/logout; Sidebar nav with role-specific links (conditional rendering placeholders for HR/Employee); Main content area for dashboard overview (e.g., quick stats or links); Tailwind classes per STYLE-001
Non_Functional_Requirements: Responsive (collapsible sidebar on mobile); Accessibility (navigable with keyboard, ARIA roles)
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HTML renders dashboard with nav sidebar using Tailwind per STYLE-001; 2. Role-specific menu items visible (e.g., via comments for HR/Employee); 3. Responsive design (sidebar collapses on small screens); 4. Logout button and welcome header present; 5. ARIA labels for navigation; 6. No broken links or styling issues
Notes: UI for US-999; Base for all post-login experiences; Updated to include placeholders for backlog features like US-006 calendar link in HR nav
